original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das shing chos kyi sku dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das shing chos kyi sku dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: This is because of the nature of being naturally in nirvāṇa and being inseparable from the dharmakāya.

original: ci ste rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas pa nyid du grub pa yin na bzlas brjod dang bsgom pa la sogs pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas pa nyid du grub pa yin na bzlas brjod dang bsgom pa la sogs pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is the case that sentient beings are established as being naturally buddhas, it follows that the recitation of mantras, meditation, and so on are pointless.

original: gsungs pa / glo bur dri mas bsgribs pa ste //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsungs pa / glo bur dri mas bsgribs pa ste // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The reply is: They are obscured by adventitious stains.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa skye ba'i sgrib pa glo bur ba rnams kyis rang gi rang bzhin nyid mi gsal bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa skye ba'i sgrib pa glo bur ba rnams kyis rang gi rang bzhin nyid mi gsal bar byas pa ste /
translated: The natural state of things is obscured by the adventitious obscurations of karma, afflictions, and birth.

original: bsgom pa dang bzlas pa la sogs pa de dag gis brtsal ba ni bla na med pa'i thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis sangs rgyas nyid do zhes ston to //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang bzlas pa la sogs pa de dag gis brtsal ba ni bla na med pa'i thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis sangs rgyas nyid do zhes ston to //
translated: The reply is that the recitation of mantras, meditation, and so on are the means of revealing that natural state of things, which is buddhahood by means of the nature of unsurpassed method and wisdom.

original: ci ste rang @186a * //
analyzed: ci ste rang @186a * //
translated: If it is the case that sentient beings are naturally buddhas,

original: bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas sems dri ma can du ji ltar 'gyur snyam na ma yin te /
analyzed: bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas sems dri ma can du ji ltar 'gyur snyam na ma yin te /
translated: If you think, “How could the mind become defiled when it is pure by nature?” it is not so.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis dben pa yin yang rdul dang khug rlangs rnams dang sprin la sogs pas dri ma can du gyur pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis dben pa yin yang rdul dang khug rlangs rnams dang sprin la sogs pas dri ma can du gyur pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as space, though naturally void, becomes defiled by dust, mist, clouds, and so on,

original: sems kyi rin po che 'di yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag tu zin kyang thog ma med pa'i dus nas skye ba gcig nas gcig tu goms pa'i bdag dang bdag gir rtog pas dri ma can du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rin po che 'di yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag tu zin kyang thog ma med pa'i dus nas skye ba gcig nas gcig tu goms pa'i bdag dang bdag gir rtog pas dri ma can du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: so too this jewel of the mind, though pure by nature, becomes defiled by the conception of “I” and “mine,” which has been habituated since beginningless time.

original: de yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa /
translated: And it is said:

original: sems can gyi tshogs 'di na de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' dag gi ye shes dang ldan pa'i sems can 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang tha snyad la mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs 'di na de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' dag gi ye shes dang ldan pa'i sems can 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang tha snyad la mngon par zhen te /
translated: “In this multitude of sentient beings, there is not a single sentient being who possesses the gnosis of the Tathāgata. Nevertheless, they are attached to conventions,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mngon par mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mngon par mi shes pa yin no //
translated: and they do not understand the gnosis of the Tathāgata.”

original: gang gi tshe tha snyad thams cad las grol ba de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang byung gi ye shes dang thogs pa med par gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe tha snyad thams cad las grol ba de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang byung gi ye shes dang thogs pa med par gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: When one is liberated from all conventions, then the self-arisen pristine wisdom of the Tathagata becomes manifest without obstruction.

original: btsan dug zos na zhes bya ba la btsan dug ni dug gi khyad par te zos na myos pa brlams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btsan dug zos na zhes bya ba la btsan dug ni dug gi khyad par te zos na myos pa brlams par 'gyur ro //
translated: As for if one eats the potent poison, the potent poison is a special kind of poison, and if one eats it, one becomes crazed.

original: su'i zhe na mi shes 'jig rten gang gis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: su'i zhe na mi shes 'jig rten gang gis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Whose? The ignorant world.

original: mi shes 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni gang zhig dug gi gnyen por gyur pa sngags la sogs pa dang bral pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni gang zhig dug gi gnyen por gyur pa sngags la sogs pa dang bral pa'o //
translated: The ignorant world is one that is devoid of the mantra, etc., which is the antidote to the poison.

original: rmongs dang bral zhing de nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rmongs dang bral zhing de nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: Free from delusion, knowing reality,

original: gang gis de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i sngags la sogs pa'i de nyid shes pa ni rmongs pa dang bral zhing de nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i sngags la sogs pa'i de nyid shes pa ni rmongs pa dang bral zhing de nyid shes pa'o //
translated: Free from delusion, knowing reality means knowing the reality of the mantra, etc., which is the antidote to that.

original: de ni de las grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni de las grol bar 'gyur //
translated: He is liberated from it.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang de kho na nyid shes pa de ni 'khor ba'i dug gi rmongs pa las grol bar 'gyur gyis gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang de kho na nyid shes pa de ni 'khor ba'i dug gi rmongs pa las grol bar 'gyur gyis gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, he who knows thatness is liberated from the poison of cyclic existence, but not otherwise.

original: zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the process just explained.

original: thabs dang shes rab shes shing lhag par khong du chud pa de'i 'khor ba ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab shes shing lhag par khong du chud pa de'i 'khor ba ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who knows and fully understands method and wisdom will turn away from cyclic existence.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje rang la byas pa //
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje rang la byas pa //
translated: The one who has done the Hevajra practice to himself

original: zhes bya ba ni bla ma gcig nas gcig tu 'ongs pa'i lhag par khong du chud pa mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bla ma gcig nas gcig tu 'ongs pa'i lhag par khong du chud pa mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: is the one who has perfected the full understanding that comes from one guru to another.

original: ma rig la sogs zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa nas rga shi'i mthar thug pa'i sdug bsngal gyi phung pos ma gzung ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig la sogs zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa nas rga shi'i mthar thug pa'i sdug bsngal gyi phung pos ma gzung ba'o //
translated: Ignorance, etc., is the collection of suffering that ends with old age and death.

original: gti mug la sogs pas kyang 'ching min zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi ba dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa gti mug la sogs pa'i zhags pas kyang 'ching ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gti mug la sogs pas kyang 'ching min zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi ba dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa gti mug la sogs pa'i zhags pas kyang 'ching ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Nor are they bound by delusion and so on” means that they are not bound by the noose of delusion and so on, such as self and mine, pleasure and pain, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas ma @186b yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i sems can 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ma @186b yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i sems can 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: “Not a non-Buddha” and so on. There are no sentient beings whatsoever who are not the nature of a Buddha.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said “because of” and so on.

original: byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa tsam nyid kyis na 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par mngon par byang chub pa yin pa la sems can thams cad khong du chud pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub pa zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa tsam nyid kyis na 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par mngon par byang chub pa yin pa la sems can thams cad khong du chud pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “Enlightenment” means that by mere self-awareness, all of these are naturally unmistakenly enlightened, and the nature of all sentient beings is understood.

original: de ltar 'gro ba rnams su ji ltar 'gro bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba rnams su ji ltar 'gro bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In that case, how do they go to the migrations?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: dmyal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'di'i don gang mi dge ba'i las kyis sprul gnas dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal shin tu mi bzad pa'i me 'bar bas dkris pa yin no //
analyzed: dmyal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'di'i don gang mi dge ba'i las kyis sprul gnas dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal shin tu mi bzad pa'i me 'bar bas dkris pa yin no //
translated: “Hell” and so on. The meaning of this is: The place produced by non-virtuous karma is a hell, and so on. It is a place wrapped in the unbearable suffering of blazing fire.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin nyid ni dus thams cad du ngo bo nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das shing bde ba chen po'i tshul gyis chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin du dbyer med pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin nyid ni dus thams cad du ngo bo nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das shing bde ba chen po'i tshul gyis chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin du dbyer med pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Their nature is always naturally beyond suffering, and is inseparable from the nature of the dharmakāya, the way of great bliss.

original: gang phyir bde ba mi shes pa //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang phyir bde ba mi shes pa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they do not know bliss,

original: gang gi phyir lha la sogs pa rnams kyi tha snyad la ma brten par spros pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin khong du chud par mi nus te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lha la sogs pa rnams kyi tha snyad la ma brten par spros pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin khong du chud par mi nus te /
translated: Because they cannot understand the nature of bliss that is free of conceptual elaborations without relying on the conventions of gods and so on,

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang tha snyad 'dogs par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang tha snyad 'dogs par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: the Tathāgatas also make conventional designations.

original: 'jig rten khams gzhan gang nas kyang //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams gzhan gang nas kyang //
translated: From no other world system whatsoever,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bla na med pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin las 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gang nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin 'ga' yang rnyed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bla na med pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin las 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gang nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin 'ga' yang rnyed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with “no buddhahood” is that the buddhahood nature is not found anywhere else in the world systems, from the nature of the unsurpassed mind.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sems nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The mind itself” and so forth.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma rnams dang bral nas sangs rgyas so ;
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma rnams dang bral nas sangs rgyas so ;
translated: The mind itself, which is naturally luminous, is buddhahood when it is free from the stains of desire and so forth.

original: / shan pa smyig ma mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: / shan pa smyig ma mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with “butchers, bamboo workers” is as follows.

original: 'di'i don ni shan pa la sogs pa rgyun mi 'chad par las rtsub mo don du gnyer ba rnams kyis kyang dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i lam du zhugs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad par gyur na rtog pa'i dra ba thams cad de ring por mi thogs par
analyzed: 'di'i don ni shan pa la sogs pa rgyun mi 'chad par las rtsub mo don du gnyer ba rnams kyis kyang dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i lam du zhugs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad par gyur na rtog pa'i dra ba thams cad de ring por mi thogs par
translated: The meaning is that even butchers and so forth, who constantly pursue violent actions, when they meet a spiritual friend who has entered the path of Hevajra, will not take long to

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: One will attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: byis pa mi shes bsgribs pa rnams //
analyzed: byis pa mi shes bsgribs pa rnams //
translated: Those who are obscured by the ignorance of childishness,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog gsum rnams mi shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas rmongs @187a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog gsum rnams mi shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas rmongs @187a * //
translated: and so on.🔽Here, the ignorance of karma, result, the four truths, and the Three Jewels is the obscuration.

original: shing bla ma mnyes par ma byas pa ni byis ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: shing bla ma mnyes par ma byas pa ni byis ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of childishness is to be confused by the grasping of self and entities connected to the self.🔽Not pleasing the guru is the ignorance of the path that was just explained.

original: des bstan ma thag pa'i lam mi shes pas steng dang 'og gi 'gro ba rnams su 'khor ba yin no //
analyzed: des bstan ma thag pa'i lam mi shes pas steng dang 'og gi 'gro ba rnams su 'khor ba yin no //
translated: One cycles in the higher and lower realms.🔽 Having attained the method of Hevajra, and so on.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i thabs thob ces bya ba la 'di'i 'don ni yang dag gang zhig myur du byang chub rdzogs par byed pa'i dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i thabs kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams yongs su sbyang ba ni 'khor ba na gnas su zin kyang ring
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i thabs thob ces bya ba la 'di'i 'don ni yang dag gang zhig myur du byang chub rdzogs par byed pa'i dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i thabs kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams yongs su sbyang ba ni 'khor ba na gnas su zin kyang ring
translated: Here, the recitation is that the entities of the form and so on of the method of Hevajra, which is the perfect one that quickly brings about the completion of awakening, are completely purified.

original: por mi thogs par bla na med par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: por mi thogs par bla na med par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: will quickly attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: pukka s'i ni sar gsungs pa //
analyzed: pukka s'i ni sar gsungs pa //
translated: The earth of Pukkasī is said to be

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: easy to understand.

analyzed: slob dpon nag pos mdzad pa'i dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel dran pa'i 'byung gnas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The master Kṛṣṇa's commentary on Hevajra called The Source of Mindfulness

analyzed: le'u bzhi pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: is the explanation of the fourth chapter.

original: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

analyzed: gdul bya rnams chos kyi rgyal po'i go 'phang la dgod pas na rgyal po'o //
translated: The king is so called because he establishes disciples in the state of a Dharma king.

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i ri bo 'joms pas na rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: Vajradhara is so called because he destroys the mountain of conceptual thought.

analyzed: zab pa dang rgya che ba'i bdag nyid kyis na dgyes pa'i rdo rje'o //
translated: Hevajra is so called because he has the nature of profundity and vastness.

analyzed: gdul bya rnams la rjes su 'tsham par ston par mdzad pas na gtso bo'o //
translated: The principal one is so called because he teaches in accordance with disciples.

analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi rang bzhin bdag / ces bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: The nature of all aspects is the self.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni bri ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni bri ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The mandala is the mandala to be drawn.

analyzed: bde ba can du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khrig pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // rnam pa kun gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: In the Blissful, etc.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnam par dag pa'i lha thams cad kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of all aspects is the nature of all the pure elements and those derived from the elements.

original: sems kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rgyur gyur pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rgyur gyur pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: The mind-vajra is the causal vajra-holder.

analyzed: sa bon gyis zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi byang chub kyi sems yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan ma la gnas pa'i h'um gis so //
translated: By the seed is by the hum which is the sign of the transformation of the relative awakening mind.

original: bco lngas yongs su bskor ba yi //
analyzed: bco lngas yongs su bskor ba yi //
translated: Surrounded by the fifteen.

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngon du bstan pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo phyag gnyis pa la sogs pa nyid de /
translated: In the passage beginning thus, etc., it is the two-armed Wheel Lady, etc., previously taught.

original: de nyid 'og nas 'byung ba //
analyzed: de nyid 'og nas 'byung ba //
translated: That is known from the passage below beginning the one stage, etc.

original: rim gcig sgo ni bzhi pa ste //
analyzed: rim gcig sgo ni bzhi pa ste //
translated: The one stage is the four doors,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes par bya'o //
translated: and so on.

analyzed: dkyil 'khor yang dag rab gsal mdzad // ces bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba // de nas ston pa ye shes che //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs der blta bar bya'o //
translated: as is known from the passage below beginning then the teacher, great wisdom, etc.

analyzed: ma lus pa'i sems can rnams rjes su bsdu @187b ba bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa / bdud bzhi yang dag mnan pa ste //
translated: In order to teach the gathering of all sentient beings, it is said:🔽the four demons are well-trodden,

analyzed: zhes bya ba la bdud bzhi po rnams zhabs bzhi pos mnan pa ste /
translated: where the four demons are trodden by the four feet.

original: rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: natural nirvana,🔽nonabiding nirvana,🔽nirvana with remainder, and🔽nirvana without remainder.

original: zhes bya bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya bya ba la /

translated: In brief, they assert that conditioned phenomena are momentary and that the entities of the world and sentient beings are momentary in order to be antidotes to permanence and so on.

original: nyan thos mdo sde pa rnams kyi gzhung mdor bsdu na bems po rnams kyi ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis snang du mi rung bas rnam par shes pa don gyi kha lo sgyur ba'i rnam pa can nyid shes pa dang shes bya'i rab tu dbye bas gnas

translated: In brief, the Sautrāntika system of the śrāvakas is that since insentient things are by nature unsuitable to appear, consciousness is the aspect that guides the object. It is the classification of consciousness and objects of consciousness.

original: pa la sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i don du snang ba'i dbang gis don nyid du yongs su btags pa yin no //
analyzed: pa la sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i don du snang ba'i dbang gis don nyid du yongs su btags pa yin no //

translated: Thus, based on those two scriptures, one realizes the characteristics of the person who is contaminated and who transmigrates, the nature of the arising of karma, afflictions, aggregates, elements, and sense bases, and the various specific types of realms, reincarnating beings, and birth processes.

original: de yang so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams shing /
analyzed: de yang so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams shing /
translated: Moreover, one is restrained by the pratimoksha vows.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi le'u las gsungs pa'i bden pa bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin goms par byas pas nyon mongs pa rnams spangs te /🔽nyan thos kyi byang chub bam /

translated: By cultivating the samadhis of the four noble truths taught in the Vajrakula chapter, one abandons the afflictions.🔽One experiences the taste of the enlightenment of the sravakas

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dag gi ro myong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: or the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung gis khams gsum po rnams rang gi sems tsam du 'dod de /
translated: The texts of the Yogacāra state that the three realms are mind only.

analyzed: de'i 'og dbu ma bshad par bya // zhes bya ba la dbu ma'i gzhung gis rnam par shes pa de nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal la zhing don thams cad las dben pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las grol zhing /
translated: Next, the Madhyamaka will be explained.🔽The texts of the Madhyamaka state that consciousness itself is naturally luminous and free from all objects, and therefore it is free from apprehended objects and apprehending subjects.

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis so sor rang gis rig pa'i ngo bo nyid tsam mngon par zhen pa'i gnas thams cad kyis stong pa yin te /

translated: Having become familiar with the characteristics of the two kinds of selflessness, they gather the accumulations of merit and wisdom for immeasurable eons.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams la rim gyis zhugs nas stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnyed par 'dod pa yin no //

translated: Then, having gradually entered the grounds of Supreme Joy and so forth, they attain the unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment that is the nature of the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so forth.

translated: If one understands it well and, without violating the mantra vows, has the intention to liberate sentient beings with great compassion, and if one makes it manifest through practice, then in this life or in other lives one will attain the unsurpassed bliss of the nature of Vajradhara.

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi zug rngu phyung ba ni bsgrub bya 'jig rten gzhan du bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba ste /

translated: How could the physical and verbal actions of one who has thus entered in order to benefit all sentient beings be non-virtuous?
